title: Best Make AI Agents Alternatives in 2025: Top 10 Tools Compared
metaDescription: Explore the top 10 Make AI Agents alternatives for workflow automation in 2025. Compare Zapier AI, Prefect, Dagster, Flyte, and more for no-code, data pipelines, and AI agents.
introduction:
Make AI Agents (formerly Integromat) has established itself as a powerful visual automation platform, introducing autonomous workflows that can analyze data and adapt processes in real-time. However, as automation needs diversify across industries, users often seek alternatives for various reasons. Some require deeper data pipeline orchestration for machine learning workloads, while others need more specialized AI agents for specific domains like legal operations or sales intelligence. The landscape of workflow automation has expanded dramatically, with tools now targeting everything from no-code business automation to complex, code-first data engineering pipelines.

Businesses evaluating Make AI Agents alternatives typically fall into several categories. Technical teams building production ML systems may find Make's visual interface limiting and seek platforms like Flyte or Dagster that treat workflows as code with strong typing and versioning. Data engineers requiring sophisticated orchestration and observability for ETL pipelines often look toward Prefect or Apache Beam ML. Meanwhile, non-technical users who prioritize ease of use and extensive app integrations might find Zapier AI's natural language automation more accessible.

The evolution of AI in workflow automation has created specialized tools that outperform general platforms in specific domains. Legal teams can leverage Checkbox AI for intake automation, while sales professionals might prefer Clay for lead enrichment. The key is matching your specific use case—whether it's adaptive business workflows, data pipeline orchestration, ML inference, or domain-specific automation—with a tool designed for that purpose. This guide examines the top 10 alternatives across different categories to help you find the right fit.

mainPlatformAnalysis.overview: Make AI Agents is a visual automation platform that enables users to build complex, adaptive workflows connecting apps and services without coding. Its AI Agents feature introduces autonomous workflows capable of analyzing data, making decisions, and adapting processes in real-time based on changing conditions. This makes it particularly valuable for businesses needing dynamic automation that responds to live data rather than following rigid, predefined paths. The platform supports thousands of app integrations through its visual builder interface.
limitations: Primarily visual interface may limit complex logic implementation for developers
Less specialized for data engineering and ML pipeline orchestration compared to code-first platforms
AI capabilities are general-purpose rather than domain-specific for legal, sales, or other verticals
mainPlatformAnalysis.pricing: Freemium model with free tier offering limited operations and data transfers. Paid plans start at $9/month for the Basic plan (10,000 operations), $16/month for Standard (40,000 operations), and $29/month for Pro (150,000 operations). Enterprise pricing available with custom limits, team features, and dedicated support.
mainPlatformAnalysis.bestFor: Business teams and citizen developers who need to create adaptive, multi-app workflows without coding, particularly those requiring real-time decision-making based on changing data conditions across integrated services.

alternatives.name: Zapier AI
alternatives.tagline: No-code automation with AI-powered workflow creation
alternatives.description: Zapier is the leading no-code automation platform connecting over 6,000 web applications to automate workflows and transfer data between them. Its key capability is enabling users to create multi-step 'Zaps' (automated workflows) triggered by events in one app to perform actions in others, significantly reducing manual tasks. What makes it unique is its extensive app ecosystem, user-friendly visual builder, and the recent integration of AI-powered features like natural language Zap creation and smart data formatting, making automation accessible to non-technical professionals. Unlike Make's focus on adaptive workflows, Zapier excels at straightforward trigger-action automation with unparalleled app coverage.
alternatives.pricing: Freemium model with free tier (100 tasks/month, 5 Zaps). Paid plans: Starter at $19.99/month (750 tasks), Professional at $49/month (2,000 tasks), Team at $69/month (2,000 tasks + collaboration), Company at custom pricing. AI features available on higher tiers.
alternatives.bestFor: Non-technical business users who need simple, reliable automation between popular SaaS applications with minimal learning curve.
cons: Less flexible for complex logic than Make
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Zapier AI over Make if you prioritize ease of use, need integrations with niche apps, or want AI-assisted workflow creation without Make's focus on adaptive, decision-making workflows.

alternatives.name: Prefect
alternatives.tagline: Modern workflow orchestration for data pipelines
alternatives.description: Prefect is a modern workflow orchestration platform designed to build, run, and monitor data pipelines. Its key capabilities include dynamic, DAG-free workflows, first-class observability, and resilient execution with sophisticated retry logic. It uniquely targets data engineers and scientists by offering a Python-native, developer-centric experience that treats workflows as code, making it distinct from rigid, static schedulers like Apache Airflow. Unlike Make's visual approach, Prefect provides programmatic control with features like parameterized flows, versioning, and hybrid execution models that support both cloud and on-premises deployment.
alternatives.pricing: Freemium model with Prefect Core (open-source, free) and Prefect Cloud (managed service). Cloud pricing: Free tier (limited runs), Team at $20/user/month, Enterprise custom pricing with advanced features.
alternatives.bestFor: Data engineers and scientists building production data pipelines who prefer code-first development over visual interfaces.
cons: Less suitable for simple business automation
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Prefect over Make if you're a developer building complex data pipelines, need programmatic control, or require sophisticated orchestration features beyond Make's visual automation capabilities.

alternatives.name: Dagster
alternatives.tagline: Asset-centric data orchestrator for reliable pipelines
alternatives.description: Dagster is an open-source, cloud-native data orchestrator designed for building, testing, and maintaining data pipelines for machine learning, analytics, and ETL. Its core innovation is an asset-centric model, where pipelines are defined around the production and consumption of data assets, providing built-in data quality testing, observability, and a strong type system. It uniquely targets the entire development lifecycle, making it particularly suited for data engineers and platform teams who need to manage complex, interdependent data workflows with reliability and developer-friendly tooling. Unlike Make's app-centric approach, Dagster focuses on data assets and their dependencies.
alternatives.pricing: Open-source core with Dagster Cloud as managed service. Cloud pricing: Free tier (limited), Team starts at $20/user/month, Enterprise custom pricing. Self-hosted option available.
alternatives.bestFor: Data platform teams managing complex, interdependent data workflows with strong requirements for data quality and observability.
cons: Less suitable for simple business automation
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Dagster over Make if you need asset-centric data orchestration, built-in data quality testing, or are managing complex data dependencies that require strong typing and observability.

alternatives.name: Flyte
alternatives.description: Flyte is a cloud-native, open-source workflow orchestration platform designed specifically for scalable, reproducible, and maintainable machine learning and data processing pipelines. It enables data scientists and engineers to define complex workflows as code with strong typing, versioning, and automatic resource management. Its unique value lies in its Kubernetes-native architecture, which provides fault-tolerant execution, multi-cluster support, and deep observability, making it distinct from general-purpose orchestrators by being purpose-built for ML/data workloads. Unlike Make's general automation, Flyte specializes in computationally intensive workflows with automatic resource optimization.
alternatives.pricing: Open-source with Flyte hosted version available. Self-hosted on Kubernetes. Enterprise support and hosted solutions available through Union.ai.
alternatives.bestFor: ML engineers and data scientists building production machine learning pipelines that require reproducibility, scalability, and Kubernetes integration.
pros: Good cost optimization through resource management
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Flyte over Make if you're building production ML pipelines, need Kubernetes-native execution, or require strong reproducibility and versioning for computational workflows.

alternatives.name: Apache Beam ML
alternatives.tagline: Unified model for portable ML inference pipelines
alternatives.description: Apache Beam ML is a component of the Apache Beam framework that provides a unified programming model for building portable, scalable data processing pipelines, with specialized APIs for machine learning inference. Its key capability is the RunInference API, which allows users to integrate trained models from multiple frameworks (like TensorFlow, PyTorch, Scikit-learn) into both batch and streaming data workflows. It uniquely enables the same ML inference logic to run identically across diverse execution engines (e.g., Apache Flink, Google Cloud Dataflow, Apache Spark) and is targeted at data engineers and ML engineers building production ML systems. Unlike Make's general automation, Beam ML focuses specifically on model inference within data pipelines.
alternatives.pricing: Open-source Apache 2.0 license. Costs depend on execution engine (Dataflow, Flink, Spark) and cloud infrastructure.
alternatives.bestFor: Data engineers integrating ML model inference into large-scale batch and streaming data pipelines across multiple execution engines.
keyFeatures: RunInference API for multiple ML frameworks
Integration with Apache Beam's rich transforms
pros: Strong integration with data processing pipelines
cons: Less suitable for simple business workflows
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Apache Beam ML over Make if you need to integrate ML model inference at scale into data pipelines, require portability across execution engines, or work with both batch and streaming data.

alternatives.name: Apache Flink ML
alternatives.tagline: Stateful stream processing for real-time ML
alternatives.description: Apache Flink ML is a machine learning library built on top of Apache Flink, designed for building and deploying scalable, end-to-end ML pipelines on streaming and batch data. Its key capability is providing a unified API for both batch and stream processing, enabling real-time model training, inference, and continuous learning directly within a high-throughput, fault-tolerant dataflow engine. It is unique for its deep integration with Flink's stateful stream processing, allowing for low-latency, stateful ML applications that are inherently distributed and resilient. Unlike Make's general automation, Flink ML specializes in real-time ML on data streams with exactly-once processing guarantees.
alternatives.pricing: Open-source Apache 2.0 license. Costs depend on Flink deployment (managed services or self-hosted infrastructure).
alternatives.bestFor: ML engineers building real-time, stateful machine learning applications on high-volume data streams with low latency requirements.
pros: Excellent for real-time ML on streams
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Apache Flink ML over Make if you need real-time ML inference on data streams, require stateful ML computations, or are building low-latency ML applications with exactly-once processing guarantees.

alternatives.name: Checkbox AI
alternatives.tagline: AI-powered legal operations and intake automation
alternatives.description: Checkbox AI is an AI-powered legal operations platform designed to automate and streamline the front-end of legal work. It uses generative AI to intelligently capture, triage, and route legal requests, automatically generating matter summaries and action items. It uniquely targets in-house legal teams by transforming chaotic email and form intake into a structured, automated workflow, reducing administrative overhead and improving response times. Unlike Make's general automation, Checkbox AI provides domain-specific AI trained on legal language and processes, making it more effective for legal workflows than general-purpose tools.
alternatives.pricing: Paid SaaS model with custom pricing based on team size and features. Typically starts at enterprise-level pricing for legal departments.
alternatives.bestFor: In-house legal teams and law firms needing to automate legal intake, matter triage, and workflow routing with AI specialized for legal terminology.
pros: Improves response times for legal requests
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Checkbox AI over Make if you're in legal operations and need domain-specific AI for intake automation, matter management, and legal workflow routing that understands legal terminology and processes.

alternatives.name: Clay
alternatives.tagline: AI-powered data enrichment and lead research
alternatives.description: Clay is an AI-powered data platform that automates lead research, contact discovery, and data enrichment for sales, recruiting, and marketing teams. It aggregates data from over 50+ sources, including social profiles, company databases, and public records, to build comprehensive profiles and lists. Its unique value lies in its 'no-code' workflow builder that allows users to create complex, multi-step data enrichment and research automations without writing code, turning manual research into a scalable process. Unlike Make's general automation, Clay specializes in data aggregation and enrichment workflows for business development purposes.
alternatives.pricing: Freemium model with free tier (50 credits/month). Paid plans: Starter at $149/month (2,500 credits), Pro at $349/month (10,000 credits), Enterprise custom pricing. Credits used for data lookups and enrichment.
alternatives.bestFor: Sales, recruiting, and marketing professionals who need to automate lead research, contact discovery, and data enrichment at scale.
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Clay over Make if you need specialized data enrichment and lead research automation, work in sales/marketing/recruiting, or want access to comprehensive B2B data sources through a no-code interface.

alternatives.name: Fathom
alternatives.tagline: AI meeting assistant for automatic note-taking
alternatives.description: Fathom is an AI meeting assistant designed to automate the note-taking process during video calls. It automatically records, transcribes, and generates concise summaries of meetings, while also allowing users to create highlight clips with a single click. It uniquely focuses on being a lightweight, real-time tool that integrates directly into Zoom, Google Meet, and Microsoft Teams calls to boost productivity for sales, customer success, and consulting professionals. Unlike Make's workflow automation, Fathom specializes in a single use case—meeting intelligence—with deep integration into video conferencing platforms.
alternatives.pricing: Freemium model with free tier (unlimited recordings, basic features). Paid plans: Pro at $32/month (additional features like CRM sync, team management), Enterprise custom pricing.
alternatives.bestFor: Sales professionals, consultants, and teams who conduct frequent video meetings and need automated note-taking, transcription, and summary generation.
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Fathom over Make if your primary automation need is meeting intelligence—transcription, summarization, and action item extraction—with deep integration into video conferencing platforms.

alternatives.name: Reclaim AI
alternatives.tagline: Intelligent scheduling assistant for calendar automation
alternatives.description: Reclaim AI is an intelligent scheduling assistant that automatically finds and blocks time in your calendar for tasks, habits, and meetings by syncing with Google Calendar. Its key capabilities include dynamically defending your time against conflicts, optimizing schedules for focus and work-life balance, and integrating with popular project management tools. It uniquely uses AI to adapt schedules in real-time, making it ideal for busy professionals, managers, and teams who need to protect their time and reduce manual calendar management. Unlike Make's general automation, Reclaim AI specializes in calendar intelligence and scheduling optimization.
alternatives.pricing: Freemium model with free tier (1 calendar, basic features). Paid plans: Starter at $8/month (1 calendar, advanced features), Business at $12/user/month (team features), Enterprise custom pricing.
alternatives.bestFor: Busy professionals, managers, and teams who need to automate calendar management, protect focus time, and optimize schedules using AI.
pros: Easy to set up and use
cons: Less flexible for other automation needs
alternatives.whySwitch: Choose Reclaim AI over Make if your primary automation need is intelligent calendar management, time blocking, and schedule optimization rather than general workflow automation across applications.

howToChoose.title: How to Choose the Right Make AI Agents Alternative

factors.name: Technical Expertise
factors.description: Evaluate your team's technical skills. Non-technical users should prioritize no-code tools like Zapier AI or Clay, while developers might prefer code-first platforms like Prefect or Dagster. Make strikes a middle ground with visual programming, but alternatives range from completely codeless to requiring Python/Java expertise.

factors.name: Primary Use Case
factors.description: Identify your core automation need. For general business automation across apps, choose Zapier AI. For data pipeline orchestration, select Prefect or Dagster. For ML workflows, consider Flyte or Apache Beam ML. For domain-specific needs like legal ops or sales intelligence, specialized tools like Checkbox AI or Clay will outperform general platforms.

factors.name: Integration Requirements
factors.description: Consider which applications you need to connect. Zapier AI has the largest app ecosystem (6,000+), while Make supports thousands. Specialized tools like Fathom integrate deeply with specific platforms (Zoom, Teams) but fewer overall. Data engineering tools like Prefect integrate with data sources and processing engines rather than business apps.

factors.name: Budget and Scale
factors.description: Assess both initial and scaling costs. Open-source tools like Prefect and Dagster have no licensing fees but require engineering resources. Freemium tools like Zapier and Clay offer free tiers but can become expensive at scale. Enterprise tools like Checkbox AI have higher entry costs but specialized value. Consider both subscription costs and the operational overhead of self-hosting.

verdict:
The best Make AI Agents alternative depends entirely on your specific use case, technical expertise, and integration requirements. For most business users seeking general automation with extensive app integrations, Zapier AI is the top recommendation—it offers similar capabilities to Make with a larger app ecosystem and more user-friendly AI features. Its natural language workflow creation and 6,000+ integrations make it accessible to non-technical teams while covering most business automation needs.

For data engineering and ML pipeline orchestration, the landscape shifts dramatically. Data engineers should evaluate Prefect for its Python-native approach and excellent observability, while teams needing asset-centric data management should consider Dagster. ML engineers building production pipelines will find Flyte's Kubernetes-native architecture and reproducibility features superior for their needs. Apache Beam ML and Apache Flink ML serve specialized niches—Beam for portable ML inference across execution engines, and Flink ML for stateful, real-time ML on data streams.

Domain-specific automation presents compelling alternatives that outperform general tools for vertical use cases. Legal teams should choose Checkbox AI for its legal-specific AI and intake automation. Sales and marketing professionals will get more value from Clay's data enrichment capabilities than from Make's general automation. For meeting intelligence, Fathom is purpose-built and superior. For calendar automation, Reclaim AI's scheduling optimization is unmatched.

Ultimately, if you need Make's specific combination of visual automation with adaptive, AI-driven decision-making, you may find no perfect replacement. However, most users will discover that specialized alternatives offer better performance for their particular needs. Evaluate based on your primary use case: choose Zapier for general business automation, Prefect/Dagster for data pipelines, specialized tools for domain-specific needs, and only stick with Make if its unique adaptive workflow capabilities are essential to your operations.

faqs.question: Is Zapier AI better than Make AI Agents?
faqs.answer: Zapier AI is better than Make AI Agents for non-technical users who prioritize ease of use and need integrations with a vast number of applications (6,000+ vs. Make's thousands). Zapier's natural language workflow creation and simpler interface make it more accessible. However, Make AI Agents is better for users who need adaptive workflows that make real-time decisions based on changing data conditions. Make offers more sophisticated logic and data transformation capabilities for complex workflows. Choose Zapier for simplicity and app coverage, Make for adaptive, decision-making automation.

faqs.question: What is the cheapest alternative to Make AI Agents?
faqs.answer: The cheapest alternatives to Make AI Agents are the open-source options: Prefect Core, Dagster, Flyte, Apache Beam ML, and Apache Flink ML. These have no licensing fees but require technical expertise to deploy and maintain. For no-code alternatives with free tiers, Zapier AI offers 100 tasks/month free, Clay provides 50 credits/month free, Fathom has unlimited free recordings, and Reclaim AI offers a free tier for individual use. Among paid options, Reclaim AI has the lowest entry price at $8/month, followed by Zapier's $19.99/month Starter plan. Consider both subscription costs and the operational costs of self-hosting open-source tools.

faqs.question: What is the best free alternative to Make AI Agents?
faqs.answer: The best free alternative depends on your use case. For general no-code automation: Zapier AI's free tier (100 tasks/month, 5 Zaps) is excellent for simple workflows. For data pipeline orchestration: Prefect Core (open-source) is powerful but requires technical expertise. For meeting automation: Fathom's free tier offers unlimited meeting recordings and transcriptions. For calendar automation: Reclaim AI's free tier provides basic scheduling features. For data enrichment: Clay's free tier includes 50 credits/month. For developers, the open-source tools (Prefect, Dagster, Flyte) offer the most capability at no cost but require engineering resources to deploy and maintain.
